Text: Mumia Abu-Jamal (born Wesley Cook; April 24, 1954) is a convicted murderer, American activist and journalist who became involved in black nationalism in his youth and was a member of the Black Panther Party until October 1970.

--------------------
Text: Mumia Abu-Jamal:  He left the party and became a radio reporter, eventually becoming president of the Philadelphia Association of Black Journalists.
